section.title: Comprehensive Privacy Protection Framework
section.description: Complete data protection policies governing our AI-powered VoIP services

sections.title: 1. Data Controller Information
content: Sawtic operates as the Data Controller for all personal information collected through our AI call center and business automation platform.
Our company is incorporated in the United Arab Emirates with our primary office located at Suite 1401, Gate Building, Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC), Dubai, UAE.
We serve businesses across the UAE and internationally with AI-powered solutions, maintaining data centers in key regions for optimal service delivery.
For all privacy-related inquiries, please contact our Data Protection Officer at privacy@sawtic.com or +971 4 864 7245.
We are registered with the UAE Telecommunications and Digital Government Regulatory Authority (TDRA) and comply with UAE Data Protection Law, GDPR, and other applicable privacy regulations.

sections.title: 2. Information We Collect
content: **Voice Data & Recordings:** We collect and process voice recordings during calls for AI training, quality assurance, and service improvement. Voice data is considered personally identifiable information under GDPR and UAE Data Protection Law.
**Call Metadata:** This includes phone numbers, call duration, timestamps, call routing information, and technical quality metrics necessary for service delivery and billing.
**Account Information:** Name, email address, company details, billing address, and authentication credentials required for account management and service provision.
**AI Interaction Data:** Conversation transcripts, sentiment analysis results, intent recognition data, and AI decision-making logs for improving our machine learning models.
**Technical Data:** IP addresses, device identifiers, browser information, operating system details, and network connection data for security and service optimization.
**Usage Analytics:** Feature utilization patterns, system performance metrics, error logs, and user behavior data to enhance platform functionality and user experience.

sections.title: 3. Lawful Basis for Processing
content: **Contractual Necessity:** We process your data to fulfill our service agreement, including providing VoIP services, billing, and technical support.
**Legitimate Interest:** We may process data for fraud prevention, service improvement, security monitoring, and business analytics where our interests don't override your privacy rights.
**Legal Compliance:** Data processing required to comply with UAE telecommunications regulations, tax obligations, anti-money laundering laws, and international legal requirements.
**Consent:** For marketing communications, non-essential cookies, and optional AI training data, we rely on your explicit consent which you can withdraw at any time.
**Vital Interests:** In rare cases, we may process data to protect life or prevent serious harm, such as emergency call routing or security threat response.
**Public Task:** Processing necessary for regulatory reporting, law enforcement cooperation, and compliance with telecommunications licensing requirements in the UAE.

sections.title: 4. AI Voice Data Processing
content: **Voice Recognition & Analysis:** Our AI systems analyze voice patterns for speech-to-text conversion, emotion detection, accent recognition, and language identification to provide personalized service experiences.
**Machine Learning Training:** Voice data may be used to train and improve our AI models, but only after de-identification and anonymization processes that remove personally identifiable elements.

**Real-Time Processing:** During active calls, our AI processes voice data in real-time for features like live transcription, sentiment analysis, and intelligent call routing without permanent storage.
**Biometric Considerations:** Voice data is considered biometric information in some jurisdictions. We implement enhanced security measures and obtain explicit consent where required by local law.
**AI Decision Making:** Our systems make automated decisions about call routing, response suggestions, and service recommendations. You have the right to request human review of these decisions.

**Data Minimization:** We process only the minimum voice data necessary for service functionality and delete raw audio after processing unless retention is required for legal or service quality purposes.

sections.title: 5. Data Sharing & Third Parties
content: **Service Providers:** We may share data with trusted third-party processors including cloud infrastructure providers (AWS, Microsoft Azure), telecommunications carriers, and payment processors under strict data processing agreements.

**AI Technology Partners:** Limited data sharing with AI model providers (OpenAI, Google Cloud AI) for service enhancement, always under comprehensive data protection agreements and with appropriate safeguards.
**Legal Requirements:** We may disclose information to comply with UAE court orders, TDRA requests, law enforcement investigations, or other legal obligations in jurisdictions where we operate.
**Business Transfers:** In the event of merger, acquisition, or business sale, your data may be transferred to the new entity with equivalent privacy protections maintained.
**Security Partnerships:** We share threat intelligence and security data with cybersecurity firms and industry partners to protect against fraud and abuse, using anonymized data where possible.
**No Sale of Personal Data:** We do not sell, rent, or trade personal information to marketers, data brokers, or other third parties for commercial purposes.

sections.title: 6. Data Security & Protection
content: **Encryption Standards:** All voice data is encrypted using AES-256 encryption in transit and at rest. Our systems use TLS 1.3 for data transmission and employ end-to-end encryption where technically feasible.
**Access Controls:** We implement role-based access controls, multi-factor authentication, and the principle of least privilege to ensure only authorized personnel can access personal data.
**Data Centers:** Our data is stored in SOC 2 Type II certified facilities in the UAE and Australia with 24/7 physical security, environmental controls, and redundant systems.
**Security Monitoring:** Continuous monitoring systems detect and respond to security threats in real-time, with incident response procedures that include immediate notification of affected users.
**Employee Training:** All staff undergo mandatory privacy and security training, sign confidentiality agreements, and are subject to background checks before accessing customer data.
**Regular Audits:** We conduct quarterly security assessments, annual penetration testing, and maintain ISO 27001 certification to ensure ongoing security effectiveness.

sections.title: 7. Data Retention & Deletion
content: **Call Recordings:** Voice recordings are retained for 24 months for service quality and legal compliance purposes, then automatically deleted unless longer retention is legally required.
**Account Data:** User account information is retained for the duration of the service relationship plus 7 years for financial and legal compliance purposes.
**AI Training Data:** Anonymized and de-identified data used for AI model training may be retained indefinitely, but cannot be re-identified or linked back to specific individuals.
**Technical Logs:** System logs and metadata are retained for 12 months for security monitoring and service optimization, then automatically purged.
**Marketing Data:** Marketing communications preferences and campaign data are retained until consent is withdrawn or the account is closed.
**Right to Erasure:** You can request deletion of your personal data at any time, subject to legal retention requirements and legitimate business needs.

sections.title: 8. Your Privacy Rights
content: **Right of Access:** You can request copies of all personal data we hold about you, including voice recordings, transcripts, and processing records, provided free of charge once per year.
**Right to Rectification:** You have the right to correct inaccurate personal information and complete incomplete data in your account at any time through our platform or by contacting support.
**Right to Erasure:** Request deletion of your personal data when it's no longer necessary for the original purpose, consent is withdrawn, or processing is unlawful.
**Right to Restrict Processing:** You can limit how we process your data in certain circumstances, such as when disputing data accuracy or while determining the legitimacy of processing.
**Right to Data Portability:** Receive your personal data in a structured, commonly used format and transmit it to another service provider where technically feasible.
**Right to Object:** Object to processing based on legitimate interests, direct marketing, or automated decision-making that significantly affects you.

sections.title: 9. International Data Transfers
content: **Cross-Border Processing:** We may transfer your data between our UAE offices, international partners, and trusted service providers to provide our AI call center services globally.
**Adequacy Decisions:** We prioritize transfers to countries with adequate data protection levels recognized by UAE authorities and the European Commission.
**Standard Contractual Clauses:** For transfers to countries without adequacy decisions, we use Standard Contractual Clauses approved by data protection authorities to ensure equivalent protection.
**Binding Corporate Rules:** Our internal data transfer policies provide consistent privacy protection across all Sawtic entities and affiliates worldwide.
**Local Data Residency:** UAE customer data is primarily processed and stored within UAE borders in compliance with TDRA data localization requirements.
**Data Subject Rights:** Your privacy rights remain fully enforceable regardless of where your data is processed or stored globally.

sections.title: 10. Cookies & Tracking Technologies
content: **Essential Cookies:** We use necessary cookies for authentication, session management, security, and core platform functionality that cannot be disabled.
**Analytics Cookies:** With your consent, we use analytics tools to understand user behavior, platform performance, and service usage patterns to improve our offerings.
**Preference Cookies:** These remember your settings, language preferences, and customizations to provide a personalized experience across sessions.
**Marketing Cookies:** We may use tracking pixels and cookies for targeted advertising and campaign effectiveness measurement, only with your explicit consent.
**Third-Party Cookies:** Some integrated services (payment processors, support chat) may set their own cookies governed by their respective privacy policies.
**Cookie Management:** You can manage cookie preferences through your browser settings or our cookie preference center, though disabling essential cookies may affect service functionality.

sections.title: 11. Children's Privacy Protection
content: **Age Restrictions:** Our services are designed for business use and are not intended for children under 18 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from minors.
**Parental Consent:** If we become aware that a child under 18 has provided personal information, we will take steps to delete such information unless parental consent is obtained.
**Educational Use:** For educational institutions using our services, special provisions apply including enhanced consent procedures and limited data processing aligned with educational purposes.
**COPPA Compliance:** While primarily serving UAE and Australian markets, we maintain COPPA-compliant practices for any US-based educational clients or family business accounts.
**Special Categories:** Voice data from children is treated as a special category requiring enhanced protection measures and limited retention periods.
**Notification Requirements:** Parents and guardians will be promptly notified if we inadvertently collect children's data, with immediate deletion unless legally permissible processing applies.

sections.title: 12. Policy Updates & Changes
content: **Notification Process:** We will notify you of material changes to this Privacy Policy via email, in-platform notifications, and website announcements at least 30 days before changes take effect.
**Version Control:** Each policy version is dated and archived, allowing you to review historical versions and understand what changes have been made over time.
**Granular Consent:** For changes requiring additional consent (such as new data uses), we will request specific opt-in consent before implementing the changes.
**Right to Object:** You have the right to object to policy changes that materially affect your privacy rights, including the option to terminate services if changes are unacceptable.
**Legal Updates:** Changes required by new laws or regulations will be implemented promptly with appropriate user communication about the legal basis for changes.
**Annual Review:** We conduct comprehensive annual reviews of our privacy practices and policies to ensure they remain current with best practices and legal requirements.
